de.jannlab.generator

Class NetCoreGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.generator.NetCoreGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetGenerator

    public class NetCoreGenerator
extends Object
implements NetGenerator
    This is the core class of the generator concept. The methods of this class define the atomic building blocks which can be used to model ANNs.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets the inner model.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface NetGenerator

      • generate

        public Net generate()
        Generates an Instance of Net from the specific inner model.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface NetGenerator

      • computeOnline

        public void computeOnline()
        Forces the generated net to compute online. This will be ignored if the net is bidirectional. A bidirectional net cannot compute online.
        A non bidirectional recurrent network computes online by default.

      • computeOffline

        public void computeOffline()
        Forces the generated net to compute offline. This will be ignored in the case of a feedforward network. A feedforward network has no time context. We define that it would compute online.
        A non bidirectional recurrent network computes online by default.

      • linkLayer

        public void linkLayer(int l1,
             int l2)
        Fully links output connector cells of the first layer with the input connector cells of the second layer (non weighted).

        Parameters:
        l1 - First layer index.
        l2 - Second layer index.

      • weightedLinkLayer

        Parameters:
        l1 - First layer index.
        l2 - Second layer index.

      • shiftComputationIndex

        public void shiftComputationIndex()
        Increment computation index. This models a time dependency in the computation process.

      • beginLayer

        Start a new layer. Returns the index of the new layer.

        Returns:
        Layer index.

      • endLayer

        public int endLayer()

        Returns:
        Layer index.

        Defines the given layer as regular computing (default).

        Parameters:
        idx - Layer index.

      • defineLayerAsReversed

        public void defineLayerAsReversed(int idx)
        Defines the given layer as reversed computing. The resulting is then bidirectional.

        Parameters:
        idx - Layer index.

      • defineInputLayer

        public void defineInputLayer(int idx)
        Defines the given layer as input layer.

        Parameters:
        idx - Layer index.

      • defineOutputLayer

        Parameters:
